title: News regarding GigaTech Inc.
story_body:
GigaTech Inc. Appoints New VP of Enterprise Solutions

GigaTech Inc. (NASDAQ: GTX) announced today the appointment of Sarah Chen as Vice President of Enterprise Solutions, effective immediately. Chen, who previously served as Senior Director of Client Services at the company, will oversee GTX's growing enterprise software division.

"Sarah has demonstrated exceptional leadership during her eight years with GigaTech," said CEO Michael Torres in a statement. "Her deep understanding of our enterprise clients' needs makes her the ideal choice for this role."

Chen replaces Robert Williams, who left the company in September to pursue other opportunities. She will report directly to Chief Operating Officer Amanda Foster and will be based at GTX's headquarters in San Jose, California.

The enterprise solutions division accounts for approximately 15% of GigaTech's annual revenue and serves over 300 corporate clients across North America. Chen's promotion comes as the company seeks to expand its footprint in the competitive enterprise software market.

In related news, GigaTech will showcase its latest cloud infrastructure products at the upcoming TechWorld Conference in Las Vegas next month. The company plans to demonstrate its new data analytics platform and updated security features at booth 1247 during the three-day event.

Additionally, GTX announced the launch of its "Tech for Tomorrow" initiative, a new corporate responsibility program aimed at providing refurbished computers to underserved schools in California. The company has committed to donating 1,000 devices over the next 12 months, along with basic technical support and training for educators.

"We believe technology should be accessible to all students," said Maria Rodriguez, GTX's Director of Corporate Social Responsibility. "This program aligns with our commitment to supporting education in our local communities."

The initiative will begin with pilot programs in Oakland and Fresno school districts, with plans to expand to additional regions based on the program's initial success.

GigaTech shares closed at $47.82 yesterday, down 0.3% for the day. The stock has traded between $42 and $53 over the past 52 weeks.
